summary: This document consists of four 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 16, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of institutional record-keeping in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks were conducted and logged for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 16, 2019.
It details the protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status (e.g., administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed and signed by watch lieutenants and a captain, indicating a chain of custody and oversight for inmate monitoring.
The document type and date place it within the timeframe of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York prior to his death in August 2019.
No specific inmate names are listed on these check sheets; they are administrative records of the observation procedure itself.
